publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3574 Sandra White: Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza—That the Parliament condemns Lloyds Banking Group for its refusal to clear donations made to Interpal, a non-political and non-profit-making British charity that works with international funding partners and partners on the ground to provide relief and development aid to Palestinians in need; notes that allegations of links with terrorist organisations made by the BBC’s Panorama programme and the Israeli Government have been rejected by the Charity Commission’s investigation; believes that this further calls into question the impartiality of the BBC and its reasoning behind its refusal to air the Gaza Crisis appeal despite overwhelming public support for this appeal to be aired, and calls on Lloyds Banking Group to reverse its decision, explain under what advice it took such a decision and for the BBC to conduct an inquiry into how its flagship public affairs programme was hijacked in this way. Supported by: Alasdair Allan*, Bill Wilson*, Patrick Harvie*, Anne McLaughlin*, Rob Gibson*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Christine Grahame*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Angela Constance*, Mike Pringle*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Michael Matheson*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Bob Doris*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Malcolm Chisholm*, Elaine Smith*, Aileen Campbell*, Bill Butler*
S3M-3574 Lloyds Banking Group Blocks Aid to Gaza (lodged on 27 February 2009) Alasdair Morgan*
